description: A tin dinner plate, lightweight and clanky.
An enameled tin cup.  Great for camping or for prison use; makes a wonderful sound when clanged along bars.
A small pewter serving bowl without a lid.  Holds 250 mL of liquid.
A glass dinner plate, for people who don't have clumsy children.
A tall drinking glass.
A stemmed drinking glass that makes you feel very fancy when you drink from it.
A glass bowl for soup or dessert.
A durable plastic plate, the sort you might use as patio dishware.
A durable plastic drinking vessel.  This one is made of clear acrylic and looks almost like glass.
A piece of plastic tupperware with a matching watertight lid.  Holds 750 mL of liquid.
A plastic bowl designed for use by children.

snippet_category.text: This bowl is decorated with cartoon bears.
There is a drawing of Yoda at the bottom of this bowl, and the words 'Eaten it all, you have'.
This bowl is covered in cartoon dogs and a logo that reads 'Paw Patrol'.
There are orange and blue fish chasing each other around the rim of this bowl.
This bowl is shaped like the head of a silly frog with the opening forming the mouth.
There are cute farm animals decorating this bowl.

description: A plastic cup with a spill-proof lid, designed for use by children.

snippet_category.text: This cup is decorated with cartoon bears.
This cup has a cartoony picture of the Avengers wrapped around the side.
This sippy cup is made of plastic in bright clashing colors.
This is a simple blue sippy cup with tooth marks around the spout.
This cup is decorated to look like a pokeball.
There are cute anthropomorphic fruits decorating this cup.
This sippy cup is decorated with crayon-like text that reads 'I love you'.

description: A fork, if you stab something with it, you eat it right away.  Wait… nevermind.
A plastic disposable fork.  Great for picnic lunches in the post-apocalyptic wasteland.
Do not try to bend the spoon.  That is impossible.
A plastic disposable spoon.  Easier to bend than the metal variety.
A plastic spoon designed for use by children.

snippet_category.text: This spoon is striped in bright primary colors.
This spoon is styled to look like a bulldozer.
This spoon is covered in cartoon dogs and a logo that reads 'Paw Patrol'.
There is a cute cartoon bear on the handle of this spoon.
There are cartoon cats all over this spoon.
This spoon has a silhouette of a giraffe going down the handle.

description: A dull knife, absolutely worthless in combat.  Excellent for spreading soft things on bread.
A plastic butter knife.  It's actually a bit sharper than its metal counterpart, but that doesn't make it any more effective as a weapon.
A plastic straw, for drinking things and littering.
Many a pleasant date has been ruined by forgetting this important tool.
//1: Lower than what the amazon link implies but I refuse to believe it's 1l of volume. 800ml is probably way overkill either way, since it has plenty of empty space that this calculation does not account for.

description: A simple tool for peeling the outer skin off fruits and veggies without stabbing yourself.
A simple lever for popping open bottles.

snippet_category.text: This bottle opener is shaped like a zombie head, the mouth pops open the bottle.
This bottle opener is shaped like a lightsaber.
This bottle opener is shaped like a revolver.
This bottle opener is engraved with the words 'I'll die before I give you my beer'.
This bottle opener is emblazoned with a logo for an HVAC contracting company.
This bottle opener reads 'Corporate Team Building Exercise 1999'.
This bottle opener reads 'I'd rather be drinking whiskey'.
This bottle opener is shaped like a phaser.
This novelty bottle opener is designed to look like a hobo clown.

description: The bastardized hybrid of a spoon and fork, with all the power and capabilities of both in a more annoying to use package.
Clearly the superior instrument.  Sporks are just imitators.
One of the most popular eating utensils in the world.  Does double duty as a way of dealing with especially fragile vampires.
When you need to scoop some soup, this is the utensil for you.
A tool designed for finely mixing ingredients or introducing air into the blend.  Also known as a 'wire whip', but it's a less effective weapon than that name makes it sound.
//1: Volume calculated as a cylinder with ~3cm diameter and 30.5cm length

description: A tool for mashing potatoes and soft root vegetables; it cannot do the twist.
A tool for squashing a clove or two of garlic into a fine paste.
A tool for opening cans that lack pull-tabs.  Now that you think about it, you haven't seen any of those around lately.
//: Based on https://www.amazon.com/dp/B087MSWH65 with the volume multiplied by 0.85 - otherwise the volume is way higher than it should be since Amazon lists package volume

description: A utensil used to hold meat still while you slice it.  It's like a tiny pitchfork, or a very large dinner fork.
A rubber scraper for making sure you get every last scrap of cookie dough.
A stout piece of hardwood, turned and sanded smooth, with rounded handles at the ends.  This timeless kitchen tool also doubles as an effective club.
A cooking pot, useful for boiling water and making all kinds of food.
This hefty black pot is made from cast iron and coated in a sturdy enamel.
A cooking pot, useful for boiling water and making all kinds of food.  Made from copper, with a lining of tin to prevent metal from leaching into acidic foods.
A ceramic pot made for both cooking and serving, particularly one-pot dinners.
A large pot with 20 gauge walls and a thick aluminum bottom, used for making soup stocks.  You could fit a whole turkey in there, with a bit of shoving.

A very large 20 liter pot, primarily meant for canning food in glass jars via the water bath method, though it can cook normal foods just as well.  Canning foods with it will require a lot of water.  If you're only canning a couple of jars at a time, you'd fill it up with rocks or something to displace the water above the lids.

A very large 25 liter earthenware pot, primarily meant for canning food via the water bath method, though it can cook normal foods just as well.  Canning foods with it will require a lot of water.  If you're only canning a couple of jars at a time, you'd fill it up with rocks or something to displace the water above the lids.
A cast-iron pan.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and is used for cooking.
//: Based on https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00006JSUA BUT volume calculated as a cylinder - 2 inches height x 10.68 inches diameter

description: A steel frying pan.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and is used for cooking.
A copper frying pan, coated in a thin layer of tin.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and is used for cooking.
A sheet of metal crudely hammered into a cooking pot.  Good enough to cook food and boil water, but not as useful as proper cookware.
A cooking pot crudely hammered out of copper.  Good enough to cook food and boil water, but not as useful as proper cookware.
A stovetop kettle for boiling water.
//1: Calculated as a cylinder of 7.44in diameter and 4.5in height. Calculating it from package dimensions of the amazon listing would give ridiculous volume.

description: A glass pot for making a cup of joe.
A stainless steel mesh colander, for washing rice and vegetables, or straining liquid off from noodles or other foods.
A stainless steel mesh screen for preventing flying oil from getting all over your nice counters (or you) when frying.
A large, flat piece of wood for chopping vegetables on without ruining your knife or your countertop.
A stainless steel tray used for serving food in cafeterias, mess halls, or similar places.
A utensil used for cutting pizza.  Practically useless in combat.
A utensil used for scooping icecream into bowls.  It has a spring powered lever to assist.
A stainless steel cheese grater with a plastic grip.  It is used to shred cheese.
A cast-iron dutch oven, suitable for boiling, broiling, roasting, baking, stewing, frying and any other method of cooking.
A large pot converted into an improvised oven, suitable for basic baking on a hot surface.
A makeshift oven made of a big clay pot with a lid, containing firebricks to hold heat and a smaller pot to bake in.
An aluminum frying pan.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and is used for cooking.
A cooking pot, useful for boiling water and making all kinds of food.  Made from aluminum.
